heading: Converting Unlike fractions to like fractions Addition and subtraction.

topics.heading: Converting Unlike fractions to like fractions Addition and subtraction.

questions.question: During the celebration preparations, one group of villagers collected 3/8 of the flowers for the decorations, while another group collected 6/13 of the flowers. What are the equivalent fractions of these amounts when converted to like fractions?
For the village square decoration, one group of villagers painted 1/6 of the area in blue, and another group painted 1/17 in green. What fraction of the square is painted by both groups together?
During the grand feast, one group of villagers used 2/20 of the available chairs, but another group used 1/50. What is the exact difference between the fractions of chairs used by the two groups?

The villagers of Fractionville were preparing drinks for the feast. One group mixed 4/11 of orange juice, and another group mixed 2/9 of apple juice. What are the equivalent fractions of these amounts when converted to like fractions?
For the dessert table, one chef-prepared 1/4 of a cake, and another chef prepared 6/7 of a cake. What are the equivalent fractions for these amounts when converted to like fractions?
During the celebration, one team served 2/8 of a cake, and another team served 5/6 of a cake. What is the total fraction of cake served during the celebration?
The villagers wanted to create flower arrangements. They used 8/9 of a garland for roses and 7/8 of another garland for lilies. What is the total fraction of garlands used for the arrangements?
The villagers wanted to decorate the feast hall with banners. One group had 3/14 of a banner with sunflowers, and another group had 1/11 with tulips. What are the like fractions for these amounts?

During the feast preparations, the villagers collected 7/10 of the flowers for decorations, and another group collected 8/15. What are the equivalent fractions of these amounts when converted to like fractions?

During the feast preparations, one group of villagers had 15/9 of a fruit basket filled with apples, and another group had 15/6 filled with oranges. What is the total fraction of fruits when these amounts are added together?

During the feast preparations, one team gathered 10/12 of the apples for the pie, while another team collected 12/15 of the apples. What are the equivalent fractions of these amounts when converted to like fractions?
During the feast, one group of villagers used 12/8 of the available chairs, and another group used 3/4. What is the difference between the fractions of chairs used by the two groups?

For the grand feast, the villagers baked cakes. One baker made 23/60 of a cake, and another baker made 12/50 of a cake. What are the equivalent fractions for these amounts when converted to like fractions?
During the celebration, one group of villagers used 25/50 of the available plates, and another group used 13/30. What is the difference between the fractions of plates used by the two groups?
For the celebration, one team prepared 9/13 of the decorations, and another team prepared 9/16. What is the difference between the fractions of decorations prepared by the two teams?
During the feast preparations, the villagers gathered 19/7 of the apples, and another group gathered 17/21 of the oranges. What is the total fraction of fruits gathered in Fractionville?

During the feast preparations, the villagers collected 3/8 of the flowers for one arrangement and 5/12 of the flowers for another arrangement. What are the equivalent fractions of these amounts of flowers when converted to like fractions?

During the celebration in Fractionville, one group of villagers harvested 11/12 of the total corn, while another group harvested 16/17. What are the equivalent fractions of these amounts when converted to like fractions?
During the feast preparations, the villagers collected 40/50 of the fruits for the baskets but used only 25/40. What is the difference between the fractions of fruits collected and used?
For the feast's dessert table, one baker made 18/7 of a pie, and another baker made 25/4 of a cake. What are the equivalent fractions for these amounts when converted to like fractions?
